description: Verify the existing application builds and runs correctly before making changes. Install dependencies and start the server to confirm baseline functionality.
steps: Run npm start to verify the server starts on port 3000
Confirm server outputs 'Server running on port 3000' message
acceptance_criteria: npm start launches the server successfully
Server logs indicate it is running on port 3000
verification: Run npm install and npm start, check for successful startup messages
findings: npm install completed successfully (102 packages, 1 low severity vulnerability). Server starts correctly on port 3000 with auto-cleanup feature for messages older than 12 hours.
